alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fentress; Jackson; Overton; Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 3:26AM CDT until July 21 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Clay County in middle Tennessee... Southern Fentress County in middle Tennessee... Jackson County in middle Tennessee... Overton County in middle Tennessee... Northeastern Putnam County in middle Tennessee... * Until 630 AM CDT. * At 326 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Livingston, Gainesboro, Algood, Allardt, Rickman, Standing Stone State Park, Crawford, Cummins Falls State Park, Whitleyville, Clarkrange, Grimsley and Granville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
